Developer's Area

Notes on writing good components

Independence of individual components from each other is the cornerstone of component-based approach to software and, therefore, the Orca project. This means that you can write your components any way you want. Still, some approaches to organizing your component code lead to more efficient, maintainable, and understandable code. These notes try to captures some of the approaches which we found useful.

  • Separate the "guts" from the external interfaces.
  • The use of finite state machines.

Other useful information

  • Notes on units and coordinate systems.
  • C++ Programming Style Guide
  • Orca CVS usage
  • Orca's Build System
  • How to develop your own components.
  • Manually running the automated tests
  • Setting up a client for the Dart testing system.

Internal Documentation

These pages are not expected to be useful for component developers who access this functionality through high level API.
